Description: A string of small bright-blue and some green glazed composition beads: one oblate, one conical, the remainder small discs. The string is completed by eight 'Conus' shells (two of them large), one 'Cowrie' shell, three 'Nerita' shells of varying size, and a large, worn 'Columbella' shell.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, grave 3241 Found in a female burial
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.317 & 1930,0711.321), shells (1930,0711.323). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 120; Tomb register, pl.LXXI; Bead register, pl.LXXIB; 'Nubia - Los reinos del Nilo en Sudàn' (Exhibit catalogue) (2003). "Cuentas" p. 206 Cat no. 138.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (637)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
